subject: Philosophy
title: Taste Is Not Just Opinion
description: A short lesson to help you apply Taste Is Not Just Opinion.

hook.text: You say a painting is brilliant. Your friend calls it trash. Is one of you right?

buildup.text: Hume argued some people have better taste â€” trained, experienced, and unbiased judges.

discovery.text: Kant went further. True aesthetic judgment isn't preference; it claims universal agreement.

twist.text: When you say 'this is beautiful,' you don't mean 'I like it.' You mean everyone should agree.

climax.text: Taste can be educated. The more art you experience, the sharper your judgment becomes.

quiz.question: What did Hume believe about aesthetic taste?
options: Some people are better judges than others
